DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Prior Cancer Progression Recurrent Neoplasm Present Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no indicator whether any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure prior to cancer progression, worsening of a cancer over time, or cancer recurrence,  reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission, is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Prior Cancer Progression Recurrent Neoplasm Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure prior to cancer progression, worsening of a cancer over time, or cancer recurrence,  reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission, being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredName: Prior Cancer Progression Recurrent Neoplasm Present
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:The reemergence of neoplasm after a period of remission:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
The reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced any severe, long term toxicity that has not been previously reported

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient experienced (
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced (prior to diagnosis of recurrence or second primary) any severe (Grade >=3), long term toxicity that has not been previously reported

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced (prior to treatment for progression or relapse or a second primary, and prior to non-protocol treatment) any severe (grade >=3) long term toxicity that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced any toxicity that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced (prior to diagnosis of progression) any reportable long term toxicity that has not been previously reported

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced any reportable long term toxicity that has not been previously reported

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced (prior to diagnosis of progression) any severe (Grade >=3), long term toxicity that has not been previously reported

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a grade 3+ adverse event that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a grade 2+ adverse event that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has no significant worsening in clinical status for a minimum of 7 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has no significant worsening in clinical status for a minimum of 2 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced any adverse events related to radiation therapy and/or had a grade 3+ adverse event that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient developed any serious or unexpected adverse event (not previously reported) that was possibly related to investigational Herceptin or other protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptoms associated with toxicities (greater that CTCAE v 5. grade 2) caused by prior cancer therapy?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Adverse Event Ind-3 (2018376v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1)
